activities.loc: Courtroom B, Third Floor - North Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rafael Enrique Martinez

records.addlTxt: Calendar call on January 19, 2023 at 08:30 am.

1:53 PM Defendant Rafael Enrique Martinez appeared by video.  Attorney Philip J. Brehm in court for Rafael Enrique Martinez.  Prosecuting attorney Margaret Nan Ginocchio appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily.  Court accepts waiver and binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information. Information filed, copy to Defendant's attorney, reading waived. Defendant's attorney pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set. Bond to continue.
Preliminary hearing on October 3, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

Activity: Initial appearance
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

10:00 AM Defendant Rafael Enrique Martinez appeared by video.  Attorney Philip J. Brehm appeared by video for Rafael Enrique Martinez.  Prosecuting attorney Margaret Nan Ginocchio appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived.  Court sets $1000 signature bond with conditions: No contact directly or indirectly with victims B.M.H. or J.A.H., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. No discussion of this case with R.W.M. Defendant requests Preliminary hearing within time limits by zoom. Preliminary hearing set for October 3, 2022 at 1:45 PM
No contact directly or indirectly with victim B.M.H. or J.A.H., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. No discussion of case with R.W.M.
